page.title: 18ALVINGHAM CHURCHES
page.content: In Alvingham there is the unique feature of{two churches within the {same church yard!}St Marys Church which is no longer used was the parish church of North Cockerington and St Adelwolds was the parish church of Alvingham. The latter is still used today as the church for both parishes. St Adelwolds is the only church in the country dedicated to this particular saint. He was a man who spent his life on Lindisfarne with St Aiden and St Cuthbert who, it is said brought Christianity to Britain. A priory was established in Alvingham in the 12th century by St Gilbert, and by 1131 the two churches were built for the increasing needs of the Gilbertine order. Evidence of the priory, such as moats and ponds in the fields and stone from the priory used in later buildings can still be found.
